model.name: Jumping on the Clouds
model.python_template:
#!/bin/python

import sys


n = int(raw_input().strip())
c = map(int,raw_input().strip().split(' '))
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n = gets.strip.to_i
c = gets.strip
c = c.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n = read n_temp :: Int
    c_temp <- getLine
    let c = map read $ words c_temp :: [Int]

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_t (read-line) 
          n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          c_temp (read-line) 
          c_t (split c_temp #"\s+") 
          c (map #(Integer/parseInt %) c_t) 
        ]
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    C = read_array(N,"~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
n = io.read("*number", "*l")
c = {}
c_temp = io.read()
c_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(c_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	c[c_i] = token
	c_i = c_i + 1
end
model.body_html:
Emma is playing a new mobile game involving clouds numbered from to . A player initially starts out on cloud , and they must jump to cloud . In each step, she can jump from any cloud to cloud or cloud .

There are two types of clouds, ordinary clouds and thunderclouds. The game ends if Emma jumps onto a thundercloud, but if she reaches the last cloud (i.e., ), she wins the game!

Can you find the minimum number of jumps Emma must make to win the game? It is guaranteed that clouds and are ordinary-clouds and it is always possible to win the game.

Input Format

The first line contains an integer, (the total number of clouds).
The second line contains space-separated binary integers describing clouds .

  • If , the cloud is an ordinary cloud.
  • If , the cloud is a thundercloud.

Constraints

Output Format

Print the minimum number of jumps needed to win the game.

Sample Input 0

7
0 0 1 0 0 1 0

Sample Output 0

4

Sample Input 1

6
0 0 0 0 1 0

Sample Output 1

3

Explanation

Sample Case 0:
Because and in our input are both , Emma must avoid and . Bearing this in mind, she can win the game with a minimum of jumps:

Sample Case 1:
